N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1551.5 - Responsibilities

State Regulations
(a) Upon initiation
of a type I project, the SUCF general manager shall direct that an
environmental impact assessment form be prepared. The completed environmental
impact assessment form shall be reviewed by an environmental quality review
committee (hereinafter referred to as "the committee"), whose membership shall
include: one appointee of the SUNY vice chancellor for capital facilities and
two appointees of the SUCF general manager. (b) The environmental impact assessment form
shall contain sufficient information for the committee to conduct an
environmental analysis to determine whether the project may or will not have a
significant effect on the environment, and will include identification of those
other agencies, including Federal agencies, which have a relationship to the
project. (c) Programmatic or generic
environmental impact statements, master or campuswide statements or statements
for comprehensive campus plans may be appropriate for use by the committee to
assess the environmental effects of (1) a number of separate projects in a
given campus area which, if considered singly may have minor effects, but if
considered together may have significant effects, (2) a chain of contemplated
projects, (3) separate projects having generic or common impacts, or (4)
programs or plans having wide application or restricting the range of future
alternative policies or projects. Such statements will eliminate multiple
sequential reviews of the same or similar actions. No further EIS's need be
prepared for projects which are included in such a statement. (d) However, amendments or supplements to
such statements must be prepared to reflect impacts which are not addressed or
adequately analyzed in such a statement as initially prepared. The public and
other agencies shall be informed of such additions through the same
notification channels specified in section
1551.6
of this
